lead_paragraph: HILL--Edward A.,45, of Washington, DC, beloved husband of Jessica Zufolo, passed away on Sunday, May 1, 2016 at Georgetown University Hospital in Washington, DC of stage IV Metastatic Esophageal cancer. Ed started his career in health care policy working as an aide for Senator Chris Murphy's first congressional campaign. Following Murphy's campaign, Ed dedicated his life and career to public service. He helped elect President Barack Obama working tirelessly as a field organizer in several states during the 2008 campaign. Ed also had a distinguished nine-year career as a senior legislative aide in the U.S. House of Representatives, where he served on the staffs of both Congressman Peter DeFazio (D-OR) and Congressman Ruben Hinojosa (D-TX). While in Congress, Ed worked on the development and passage of the Affordable Care Act. Ed also played a pivotal role in advocating for America's microbreweries through his management of the bipartisan Congressional Small Brewers Caucus, which today boasts 207 members of Congress. Most recently, Ed was a lobbyist for Association of Marriage and Family Therapists. Ed was deeply loved and cherished by his wife and two dogs, Hopper and Stewie. His lovable personality and hilarious sense of humor brought tremendous joy to everyone who knew him. Thank you Ed for being my partner and best friend. I will miss you. 1/3
